name: 賀一平
objective: Issues and topics discussed include: legalizing drugs, capital punishment, plastic surgery; abortion, heroes and fan worship, and relationships. The young adult novels used for common readings are: A Solitary Blue and A Single Sahrd. For individualzied independent reading, students have freedom to choose to read any young adult novels that interest them.
schedule:
Topics for Study and Discussion
1st week: Orientation
2nd week: Gays and jobs
3rd week: Gay families
4th week:　　 Marriage, Cohabitation, Staying single
5th week: Marriage—for better or for worse/Cheating on your partner
6th week: Sex for sale
7th week: Sexual harassment (Submitting journal entries on the previous topics)
8th week: Young adult novel session: Sharing journal entries and engaging in group discussion
9th week: Young adult novel session: Submitting response journal entries and making oral presentations
10th week: Animal rights
11th week: The right to die/Euthanasia
12th week: The right to die/Euthanasia
13th week: Legalizing drugs
14th week: Cosmetic surgery/Are you happy with your body?
15th week: Designer babies/Cloning
16th week: The death penalty (Submitting journal entries on the precious topics)
17th week: Young adult novel session: Sharing journal entries and engaging in group discussion and submitting journal entries
18th week: Oral test focusing on young adult novels
scorePolicy:
